instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 - Green/orange Light and PPBUS_G3H 1.9V
threads.message:
This is my second post today!
So, i get green/orange light but my PPBUS_G3H is 1.9V
I don't get short to ground, so any hint ?

Thank you

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 - Green/orange Light and PPBUS_G3H 1.9V
threads.message:
U7100:

Voltage on pin 2
Resistance between pin 17-18 and 27-28
Resistance to GND on F7140

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 - Green/orange Light and PPBUS_G3H 1.9V
threads.message: Check R7121 and R7122 and traces, could be an open resistor and/or trace.......

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 - Green/orange Light and PPBUS_G3H 1.9V
threads.message:
R7121 is bad!
I replaced and i get 20Ω - 27 - 28

But Still in 1.9V PPBUS_G3H

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 - Green/orange Light and PPBUS_G3H 1.9V
threads.message: Bad U7100, how else would R7121 have blown?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 - Green/orange Light and PPBUS_G3H 1.9V
threads.message:
[USER="1"]larossmann[/USER] 

I Replaced U7100 and nothing change. 
I find out the Q7130 get warm, so i replaced and i get back my PPBUS_G3H.
Right now, my PP5V_S0 i get 4.03V .

​​​​​​​any hint from this point?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 - Green/orange Light and PPBUS_G3H 1.9V
threads.message: I figure out and everything come up, but doesn't work without the charger

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 - Green/orange Light and PPBUS_G3H 1.9V
threads.message: But does it charge the battery? Is there voltage on PPBUS with only battery connected?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 - Green/orange Light and PPBUS_G3H 1.9V
threads.message: Just the battery connect , i get 0V on PPBUS

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 - Green/orange Light and PPBUS_G3H 1.9V
threads.message: Also 0V on battery connector positive terminals? If yes then battery is dead.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 - Green/orange Light and PPBUS_G3H 1.9V
threads.message:
Yes, the battery is bad!
Replaced and works!

Thank you, Duke
